intro: Orthocarpus hispidus, commonly known as the hairy orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in umbrella-like arrangements. Orthocarpus hispidus is typically found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
